headline: CAE taps Northrop Grumman’s Matthew Bromberg as new CEO
summary: Investing.com -- Canadian aviation and defense technology firm CAE (NYSE:CAE) announced on Monday that it has picked Matthew Bromberg, a senior executive from Northrop Grumman (NYSE:NOC), as its new chief executive officer. Bromberg is slated to take up his new role on August 13, succeeding Marc Parent, who has led the company since 2009 and made his departure known in November of the previous year.

raw.headline: CAE taps Northrop Grumman’s Matthew Bromberg as new CEO
raw.summary: Investing.com -- Canadian aviation and defense technology firm CAE (NYSE:CAE) announced on Monday that it has picked Matthew Bromberg, a senior executive from Northrop Grumman (NYSE:NOC), as its new chief executive officer. Bromberg is slated to take up his new role on August 13, succeeding Marc Parent, who has led the company since 2009 and made his departure known in November of the previous year.

headline: Canada's aviation firm CAE taps Northrop Grumman's Matthew Bromberg as CEO
summary: Bromberg, set to join on August 13, will be succeeding Marc Parent, who has been at the helm since 2009 and had announced his departure in November last year.  Bromberg has been working as the head of global operations for Northrop Grumman since 2022 and has also worked for RTX Corp, leading its military engine business.  The appointment follows activist investor Browning West in December pushing to have a say in hiring CAE's new top boss, after building a 4.3% stake in the company.
